fr.sorbonne_u.components

Class AbstractPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractClientSidePlugin, DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin, DynamicConnectionClientSidePlugin, DynamicConnectionServerSidePlugin

    public abstract class AbstractPlugin
extends java.lang.Object
implements PluginI
    The abstract class AbstractPlugin defines the most generic methods and data for component plug-ins.

    Description

    Plug-ins are objects designed to extend the functionalities of component and enable a form of reuse among components. The idea if to implement component services as methods in plug-ins and call these plug-in methods directly from the component service implementation methods or from inbound ports (inbound ports for plug-ins provided in BCM ease this process). A plug-in has an URI and a component can only have one plug-in object of a given URI (though more than one plug-in object of the same plug-in class may exist in a component albeit with different URIs). AbstractComponent implements the plug-in management, among which it provides a way to retrieve the plug-in object reference from its URI.

    A plug-in has its own life-cycle, including initialisation which can be used to add interfaces and ports to their hosting component. Hence, the typical usage of plug-ins is to implement some services which are exposed as offered interfaces and inbound ports or to require some services which are exposed as required interfaces and outbound ports. Hence a complete client/server relationship between two components can be implemented through a client plug-in installed on the client component and a server plug-in installed in the server component, with the two complementary plug-ins completely hiding from the component programmer the issues revolving around required/offered interfaces and outbound/inbound ports to be used.

    Plug-in objects are created from their class and installed on a component using components plug-in management services implemented by all components. Every component offers the interface ComponentPluginI and has a ComponentPluginInboundPort automatically added at creation time to offer these services.

    AbstractPlugin is placed in the same package as AbstractComponent to provide it with an access to a package visibility method doAddPort allowing to add a port to the plug-in owner component without resorting to a public method to do so.

    Invariant

     invariant              true            // TODO

      • createNewExecutorService

        protected int createNewExecutorService(java.lang.String uri,
                                       int nbThreads,
                                       boolean schedulable,
                                       AbstractComponent.ExecutorServiceFactory factory)
        create a new user-defined executor service under the given URI and with the given number of threads.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null
 pre    !this.validExecutorServiceURI(uri)
 pre     nbThreads > 0
 pre    factory != null
 pre    schedulable ?
                        factory.createExecutorService(nbThreads) instanceof
                                                                                                ScheduledExecutorService
                :       factory.createExecutorService(nbThreads) instanceof
                                                                                                ExecutorService
 post   this.validExecutorServiceURI(uri)
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of the new executor service.
        nbThreads - number of threads of the new executor service.
        schedulable - if true, the new executor service is schedulable otherwise it is not.
        factory - an executor service factory used to create the new thread pool.
        Returns:
        the index associated with the new executor service.

      • scheduleTaskAtFixedRateOnComponent

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskAtFixedRateOnComponent(int executorServiceIndex,
                                                                                     ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                                                     long initialDelay,
                                                                                     long period,
                                                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
                                                                              throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                                                     java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        schedule a ComponentTask that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, the initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor. If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late, but will not concurrently execute.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        executorServiceIndex - index of the executor service that will run the task.
        t - task to be scheduled.
        initialDelay - delay after which the task begins to run.
        period - period between successive executions.
        u - time unit in which the initial delay and the period are expressed.
        Returns:
        a scheduled future allowing to cancel and synchronize on the task execution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException

      • scheduleTaskAtFixedRateOnComponent

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskAtFixedRateOnComponent(java.lang.String executorServiceURI,
                                                                                     ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                                                     long initialDelay,
                                                                                     long period,
                                                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
                                                                              throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                                                     java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        schedule a ComponentTask that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, the initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor. If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late, but will not concurrently execute.

        Contract

 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:

        period - period between successive executions.
        u - time unit in which the initial delay and the period are expressed.
        Returns:
        a scheduled future allowing to cancel and synchronize on the task execution.

        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.

      • scheduleTaskAtFixedRateOnComponent

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskAtFixedRateOnComponent(ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                                                     long initialDelay,
                                                                                     long period,
                                                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
                                                                              throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                                                     java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        schedule a ComponentTask that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, the initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor. If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late, but will not concurrently execute.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - task to be scheduled.
        initialDelay - delay after which the task begins to run.
        period - period between successive executions.
        u - time unit in which the initial delay and the period are expressed.
        Returns:
        a scheduled future allowing to cancel and synchronize on the task execution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the preconditions are not satisfied.
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.

      • scheduleTaskWithFixedDelayOnComponent

        protected java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskWithFixedDelayOnComponent(int executorServiceIndex,
                                                                                        ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                                                        long initialDelay,
                                                                                        long delay,
                                                                                        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
                                                                                 throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                                                        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        schedule a ComponentTask that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the beginning of the next. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        executorServiceIndex - index of the executor service that will run the task.
        t - task to be scheduled.
        initialDelay - delay after which the task begins to run.
        delay - delay between the termination of one execution and the beginning of the next.
        u - time unit in which the initial delay and the delay are expressed.
        Returns:
        a scheduled future allowing to cancel and synchronize on the task execution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the preconditions are not satisfied.
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.

      • handleRequest

        protected <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> handleRequest(int executorServiceIndex,
                                                           ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
                                                    throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                           java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        execute a request represented by a ComponentService on the owner component.

        Description

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value returned by the request.
        Parameters:
        executorServiceIndex - index of the executor service that will run the task.
        request - service request to be executed on the component.
        Returns:
        a future value embedding the result of the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the component is not started, the index is not valid or the request is null.
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.

      • handleRequest

        protected <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> handleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
                                                    throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                           java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        execute a request represented by a ComponentService on the owner component.

        Description

        This method is meant to be used when programmers need to manage within a component requests with futures. It can be requests executed as services of the component or calls to other components which are synchronous but that the calling component wants to manage as asynchronous tasks.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value returned by the request.
        Parameters:
        request - service request to be executed on the component.
        Returns:
        a future value embedding the result of the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the component is not started or the request is null.
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.

      • scheduleRequest

        protected <T> java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<T> scheduleRequest(int executorServiceIndex,
                                                                      ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request,
                                                                      long delay,
                                                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
                                                               throws java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                                      java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
        schedule a service for execution after a given delay.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the value returned by the request.
        Parameters:
        executorServiceIndex - index of the executor service that will run the task.
        request - service request to be scheduled.
        delay - delay after which the task must be run.
        u - time unit in which the delay is expressed.
        Returns:
        a scheduled future to synchronise with the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the component is not started, this index is not valid, the executor is not schedulable or the request in null.
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.
